body: @Mur4ik Yes, sorry I forgot to include it in the post. I have set preferFlash to false.

```
SoundManager 2: soundManager: Fatal error: Flash is needed to play some required formats, but is not available. soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
SoundManager 2 HTML5 support: mp3 = false (using flash), mp4 = false (using flash), ogg = true, opus = true, wav = true soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
```
That is true for old FF versions.

But in fresh FF without flash plugin installed, your app get in console:
```
SoundManager 2: No Flash detected. Trying HTML5-only mode.  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:33:488
SoundManager V2.97a.20150601 (HTML5-only mode)  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:33:488
SoundManager 2 HTML5 support: mp3 = true, mp4 = true, ogg = true, opus = true, wav = true  soundmanager2-jsmin.js:33:488
SoundManager 2: Ready. âœ“
```
So most of sound formats is supported without flash.

Looks like this issue not related to Ubuntu but can be depends on version of Firefox.

I can not start your app, just a black screen and error message in console about connection to your websocket server.
Or maybe your error not related to sound manager at all?

@Mur4ik That means it started and is working, I just didn't have the multiplayer servers running.

So, it's just an issue with old Firefox, that makes sense. But, I am not using any sound at the moment, so they are not **required** formats. Is this a bug?

Can you please provide a versions of Ubuntu and Firefox that cause an issue?
And Soundmanager2 V2.97a.20130512 (from libGDX 1.9.5 and below) and V2.97a.20150601 (from libGDX 1.9.6-SNAPSHOT) have the same behavior?
Does update Firefox to latest version fix the issue?
I'll send a PR which adds a config, to entirely disable sound when not needed.

@Mur4ik That workaround looks perfect, I will try that out. And I'll see what version of Firefox it is. It is the preinstalled version on an Ubuntu LiveCD.

@intrigus that looks cool.
@Mur4ik It is Firefox version 47.0, and I can't get the workaround working because sound manager is not recognized as a variable. But, I will keep tweaking it to try to get it to work.

There is no simple and quick way to workaround ATM without "hacking" GwtApplication.java.
Fastest solution is just replace soundmanager2-jsmin.js with patched one.
Download from here https://github.com/scottschiller/SoundManager2/blob/master/script/soundmanager2.js#L167 and just change "true" to "false" :).

For complete fix or handling possible problems in future versions of libGDX GwtApplication.java, GwtApplicationConfiguration.java and SoundManager.java should be refactored for more flexible app initialization.
@Mur4ik awesome, I will try that. Thanks a lot for your help.

issue.title: GwtApplication refactoring + small GWT SoundManager improvements for better flexibility
issue.body: GwtApplication refactoring + small GWT SoundManager improvements for better flexibility
